items.abstract: <jats:p>In 2007, Maddux observed that certain classes of representable relation</jats:p><jats:p>algebras (RRAs) form sound semantics for some relevant logics. In particular,</jats:p><jats:p>(a) RRAs of transitive relations are sound for R, and (b) RRAs of transitive,</jats:p><jats:p>dense relations are sound for RM. He asked whether they were complete as</jats:p><jats:p>well. Later that year I proved a modest positive result in a similar direction,</jats:p><jats:p>namely that weakly associative relation algebras, a class (much) larger than</jats:p><jats:p>RRA, is sound and complete for positive relevant logic B. In 2008, Mikulas proved a</jats:p><jats:p>negative result: that RRAs of transitive relations are not complete for R.</jats:p><jats:p>His proof is indirect: he shows that the quasivariety of appropriate</jats:p><jats:p>reducts of transitive RRAs is not finitely based. Later Maddux re-established</jats:p><jats:p>the result in a more direct way. In 2010, Maddux proved a contrasting positive result: that transitive, dense RRAs are complete for RM. He found an embedding of Sugihara algebras into transitive, dense RRAs. I will show that if we give up the requirement of representability, the positive result holds for R as well. To be precise, the following theorem holds.</jats:p><jats:p>Theorem. Every normal subdirectly irreducible De Morgan monoid in the language</jats:p><jats:p>without Ackermann constant can be embedded into a square-increasing relation</jats:p><jats:p>algebra. Therefore, the variety of such algebras is sound and complete for R.</jats:p>
title: Relevant logic and relation algebras

            <jats:p>It is proved that free dynamic algebras superamalgamate. Craig interpolation for propositional dynamic logic and superamalgamation for the variety of dynamic algebras follow.</jats:p>

items.abstract: <jats:p>Results of the first studies in Poland on <em>Cristulariella depraedans</em>, the causal agent of necroses on tree and shrub leaves, are presented. The fungus was recorded on <em>Acer platanoides, A. pseudoplatanus</em> and eight other species of trees and shrubs, including <em>Corylus avellana, Fagus sylvatica, Lonicera xylosteum</em> and <em>Padus avium</em> that were not previously known as hosts of the fungus. The disease symptoms, which depend on the host plant species, the size and number of necrotic lesions on leaves, and the morphological features of the fungal propagules were characterized.</jats:p>
title: Cristulariella depraedans as causal agent of leaf spots of maple and other trees and shrubs
An Abelian Rule for BCI—and Variations

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
            <jats:p>We prove that certain natural sequent systems for bi-intuitionistic logic have the analytic cut property. In the process we show that the (global) subformula property implies the (local) analytic cut property, thereby demonstrating their equivalence. Applying a version of Maehara technique modified in several ways, we prove that bi-intuitionistic logic enjoys the classical Craig interpolation property and Maximova variable separation property; its Halldén completeness follows.</jats:p>
title: ANALYTIC CUT AND INTERPOLATION FOR BI-INTUITIONISTIC LOGIC
